alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Mobile; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 17 at 9:07PM CDT until April 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mobile County in southwestern Alabama... Southern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... South central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... George County in southeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 906 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Ovett to Richton to 5 miles northwest of Beaumont to New Augusta, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. Tornadoes will also be possible as this line moves through the warned area. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Tillmans Corner, Saraland, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Citronelle, Lucedale, Creola, Leakesville, Chunchula, Gulfcrest, Deer Park, Axis, Tibbie, Mount Vernon, Calvert, Tanner Williams and Semmes. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
